test_cases.description: Verify that a task is created successfully when valid task_data is provided.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_valid_data

test_setup.given: A valid task_data dictionary (e.g., {'title': 'Test Task', 'description': 'Details', 'user_id': 1}) and a user exists.
test_setup.then: The task is created and the repository returns the created task object. Operation is logged.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with valid task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that the function handles missing required fields in task_data appropriately.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_missing_required_field

test_setup.given: A task_data dictionary missing a required field (e.g., missing 'title').
test_setup.then: The function raises a validation error or the repository returns an error. Operation is logged.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with incomplete task_data.

test_cases.description: Verify that the function handles empty task_data correctly.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_empty_data

test_setup.then: The function raises a validation error or the repository returns an error. Operation is logged.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with empty data.

test_cases.description: Verify that the function can handle very large field values (e.g., a very long title or description).
test_cases.name: create_task_with_large_input

test_setup.given: A task_data dictionary with 'title' or 'description' set to a very long string (e.g., 10,000 characters).
test_setup.then: The function either creates the task successfully or returns an appropriate error if limits are exceeded. Operation is logged.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with the large input.

test_cases.description: Verify that the function handles task_data with incorrect data types (e.g., 'user_id' is a string instead of an integer).
test_cases.name: create_task_with_invalid_data_type

test_setup.given: A task_data dictionary with incorrect types (e.g., {'title': 'Task', 'user_id': 'not-an-integer'}).
test_setup.then: The function raises a validation error or the repository returns an error. Operation is logged.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with invalid data types.

test_cases.description: Verify that the function handles repository failures gracefully (e.g., DB is down).
test_cases.name: create_task_repository_failure

test_setup.given: A valid task_data dictionary and the repository's add_task method is mocked to raise an exception (e.g., database error).
test_setup.then: The function handles the exception gracefully, possibly raising or logging it. Operation is logged.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called.

test_cases.description: Verify handling of creating a task with data that would result in a duplicate entry (if uniqueness is enforced).
test_cases.name: create_task_with_duplicate_data

test_setup.given: A task_data dictionary that matches an existing task's unique fields (e.g., same title for the same user if titles are unique per user).
test_setup.then: The function or repository returns a duplicate error. Operation is logged.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called with duplicate data.

test_cases.description: Verify that the function creates a task when only the minimum required fields are provided.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_minimum_valid_data

test_setup.given: A task_data dictionary with only the minimally required fields filled (e.g., only 'title' and 'user_id').
test_setup.then: The task is created successfully with default or null values for optional fields. Operation is logged.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called.

test_cases.description: Verify that the function logs the creation attempt for the user.
test_cases.name: create_task_logging_verification

test_setup.given: A valid task_data dictionary and a configured logging system (mocked if needed).
test_setup.then: A log entry indicating the creation attempt for the user is generated.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called.

test_cases.description: Verify that the function handles task_data with null values for optional and required fields.
test_cases.name: create_task_with_null_values

test_setup.given: A task_data dictionary with null values for one or more fields, including required fields.
test_setup.then: The function returns a validation error for required fields and handles optional fields as permitted. Operation is logged.
test_setup.when: TaskService.create_task is called.

test_cases.description: Test adding a task with valid, typical data and verify task is persisted and returned with unique ID.

test_setup.given: No existing tasks in the system.
test_setup.then: The task is created and the response contains the task details with a new id.
test_setup.when: A valid POST request is made to /tasks with all required fields.

test_cases.description: Verify that the API returns HTTP 400 when the title field is missing in the request body.
test_cases.name: create_task_missing_title

test_setup.then: API responds with HTTP 400 and an error message about the missing title.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made to /tasks without the title field.

test_cases.description: Verify that the API returns HTTP 400 when the title field is empty.
test_cases.name: create_task_empty_title

test_setup.then: API responds with HTTP 400 and a message indicating the title cannot be empty.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made to /tasks with an empty title.

test_cases.description: Verify that the API returns HTTP 400 when an invalid priority value is provided.
test_cases.name: create_task_invalid_priority

response_body_json.detail: Priority must be one of: low, medium, high.

test_setup.then: API responds with HTTP 400 and an error message about invalid priority.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made to /tasks with an invalid priority value.

test_cases.description: Verify creation of a task when due_date is not provided (assuming due_date is optional).
test_cases.name: create_task_missing_due_date

test_setup.then: Task is created successfully with due_date as null or omitted.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made to /tasks without due_date.

test_cases.description: Verify that the API returns HTTP 400 when due_date is not in a valid date format.
test_cases.name: create_task_invalid_due_date_format

response_body_json.detail: due_date must be in YYYY-MM-DD format.

test_setup.then: API responds with HTTP 400 and error about date format.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made with due_date in incorrect format.

test_cases.description: Verify that the API handles titles at the maximum allowed length.
test_cases.name: create_task_large_title

test_setup.then: Task is created successfully.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made with title at its maximum allowed length.

test_cases.description: Verify that the API returns HTTP 400 when the title exceeds the maximum allowed length.
test_cases.name: create_task_title_exceeds_max_length

response_body_json.detail: Title exceeds maximum allowed length of 255 characters.

test_setup.then: API responds with HTTP 400 and error about title length.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made with a title longer than 255 characters.

test_cases.description: Verify that the API returns HTTP 400 when the request body is not valid JSON.
test_cases.name: create_task_invalid_json_body

test_setup.then: API responds with HTTP 400 and an error about invalid JSON.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made with a malformed JSON body.

test_cases.description: Verify that the API returns HTTP 400 when creating a task with a duplicate title (if title uniqueness is enforced).
test_cases.name: create_task_duplicate_title

response_body_json.detail: A task with this title already exists.

test_setup.given: A task with title 'Unique Task Title' already exists.
test_setup.then: API responds with HTTP 400 and error about duplicate title.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made with the same title.

test_cases.description: Verify that the API ignores or rejects extra fields not defined in TaskCreate schema.
test_cases.name: create_task_extra_fields

test_setup.then: API responds with HTTP 400 and error about unexpected field.
test_setup.when: A POST request is made with an extra field not specified in the schema.

response_body_json.error: Priority value exceeds maximum allowed length

test_setup.given: Priority is provided as a string longer than allowed (e.g., 256 characters).
test_setup.then: 400 error response with descriptive message is returned.
test_setup.when: POST request is made to /tasks.

test_cases.description: Tests successful creation when all fields are at their maximum allowed lengths (edge condition).
test_cases.name: Create task with all fields at maximum allowed length

test_setup.given: All fields provided at their maximum allowed lengths.
test_setup.then: Task is created successfully and 201 response is returned.
test_setup.when: POST request is made to /tasks.

test_cases.description: Tests successful creation when all fields are at their minimum allowed lengths (single character).
test_cases.name: Create task with all fields at minimum allowed length

test_setup.given: All fields provided at minimum allowed length (single character).
test_setup.then: Task is created successfully and 201 response is returned.
test_setup.when: POST request is made to /tasks.
